transcript:
Losing something we love, or someone who 
is dear to us, can cause us a lot of pain.  
To accept the loss and overcome the pain, 
we often go through five stages of grief.
Denial, anger, bargaining, 
depression, and finally acceptance.
Getting to acceptance, however, 
does not mean it is over.
Grief is a complex emotional response to loss,  
particularly the loss of someone we love 
or something deeply meaningful — like a  
job. This process is unique to each 
of us and is not always linear.
Often we cycle back, revisit stages or experience  
some entirely new emotions. Sometimes 
it can feel like we are regressing,  
but with the support of others and each 
new day, time will help heal our wounds.
